question: A.003 [1.0 point] (3.0) Which ONE of the following is true concerning the differences between prompt and delayed neutrons?

answers.answer: a. Prompt neutrons account for less than 1% of the neutron population while delayed neutrons account for approximately 99% of the neutron population.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REFERENCE: Intro to Nuc Eng, John R. Lamarsh © 1983, § 3.7 pp. 73 – 75.

answers.answer: b. Prompt neutrons are released during fast fissions while delayed neutrons are released during thermal fissions.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REFERENCE: Intro to Nuc Eng, John R. Lamarsh © 1983, § 3.7 pp. 73 – 75.

answers.answer: c. Prompt neutrons are released during the fission process while delayed neutrons are released during the decay process.
answers.feedback: Correct. REFERENCE: Intro to Nuc Eng, John R. Lamarsh © 1983, § 3.7 pp. 73 – 75.

answers.answer: d. Prompt neutrons are the dominating factor in determining the reactor period while delayed neutrons have little effect on the reactor period.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REFERENCE: Intro to Nuc Eng, John R. Lamarsh © 1983, § 3.7 pp. 73 – 75.

question: A.009 [1.0 point] (9.0) Which ONE of the following is the reason for an installed neutron source within the reactor? A startup without a neutron source...

answers.answer: a. is impossible as there would be no neutrons available to start the fission process.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REFERENCE: Standard NRC Reactor Theory

answers.answer: b. would be very slow due to the long time to build up neutron population from so low a level.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REFERENCE: Standard NRC Reactor Theory

answers.answer: c. could result in a very short period due to the reactor going critical before neutron population can build up high enough to be read on nuclear instrumentation.
answers.feedback: Correct. REFERENCE: Standard NRC Reactor Theory

answers.answer: d. can be compensated for by adjusting the compensating voltage on the source range detector.
